DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Calcium Electrolytes Outcome Lower Limit of Normal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a numeric value quantifying the lowest result in the normal range of values for calcium in peripheral blood serum used as a comparative reference for the lab test of a patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for calcium electrolytes, substances that break up into ions (electrically charged particles) when they are dissolved in body fluids and are primarily responsible for the movement of nutrients into cells and the movement of wastes out of cells.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A malleable silvery-white metallic element of the alkaline hearth group; the fifth most abundant element in the earth crust, occurring especially as forms of calcium carbonate. It is an essential constituent of bones and teeth.  It has the symbol Ca and atomic number 20.:(eh-LEK-tro-lites) Substances that break up into ions (electrically charged particles) when they are dissolved in body fluids or water.  Some examples are sodium, potassium, chloride, and calcium.  Electrolytes are primarily responsible for the movement of nutrients into cells and the movement of wastes out of cells.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Ca, atomic number 20, and atomic weight 40.08.

Substances that ionize into anions and cations in body fluids.  Electrolytes regulate nerve and muscle function and water distribution between cells, plasma, and interstitial fluid.  Imbalances can cause serious physiologic effects, including seizures, cardiac arrhythmias and convulsions.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Calcium Lab Lower Limit of Normal Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numeric value quantifying the lowest result in the normal range of values for calcium in peripheral blood serum used as a comparative reference for the lab test of a patient.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The bottom of the normal range for a particular laboratory result.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The lowest value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changes for initial use on protocol; minor changes to make ISO 11179 compliant for Release
